node.category: What is the way things are?

node.surface: Secret services must be more tightly regulated

node.category: Why must the secret services be more tightly regulated?

node.surface: in order to prevent excessive surveillance.
After all, secret services tend to develop a life of their own (a state within a state),

node.category: What could be the consequence if we don’t regulate the secret services?

node.surface: which would be irresponsible for democratic states.
Besides, intelligence services intervene massively in the privacy of citizens
and must therefore be monitored more closely

node.category: What other factors affect intelligence services?

node.surface: Parliamentary control however hampers the work of intelligence services

node.category: How does parliamentary control hamper the work of intelligence services?

node.surface: for it jeopardizes the secrecy and security of confidential data and informants.
